title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned by writing the ratio   ( x−7 ) n+1 ( n+1 ) ⋅  5 n+1   ( x−7 ) n n ⋅  5 n MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5EB0@ or equivalent. The ratio can be written with or without absolute value symbols. Once earned this point cannot be lost. Any errors in simplification or evaluation of the limit will not earn the second point.

The ratio may be expressed in either of the forms a n+1 a n MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F66@ or a n a n−1 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@403D@ An expression equivalent to a n a n+1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EBB@ earns the first point, and is eligible for the remaining points.

Read for the second and third points with incorrect ratios.

A response that presents no ratio does not earn the second point.

Proper limit notation must be used in order to earn the second point.

The third point is earned for 2<x<12, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EE2@ or for 1 5   |  x−7  |<1, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@48FE@ with or without inclusion of the endpoints.

A response that presents an incorrect limit is eligible for the third point. In this case the point would be earned for finding an interior interval of convergence that is consistent with a presented limit of the form |   x−7 b   |, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@440D@ where b = 0. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C84@

A response that presents an infinite interval of convergence is not eligible for the fourth or fifth points.

A response that begins with 1 5   |  x−7  |<1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@48AC@ or 2<x<12 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E32@ does not earn the first 2 points but is eligible for the fourth and fifth points.

The fourth point is earned for considering both endpoints of the correct interval or both endpoints of an incorrect interval that has earned the third point.

To earn the fifth point, the response must have earned the fourth point, must correctly analyze the series at each of the endpoints, and must state the test(s) used for each analysis. A response does not need to address the conditions necessary to apply the test at each endpoint.

The fifth point cannot be earned with an incorrect interval. If the analysis at either endpoint is incorrect, the fifth point is not earned.

Root test: A response that uses the root test instead of the ratio test is scored as follows for the first 2 points (with third, fourth, and fifth points scored as described above):

· First point (Sets up root): | a n | n = | (x−7) n n 5 n | n = |  x−7  | 5 n n MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5962@

· Second point (Computes limit of root): lim n→∞ |  x−7  | 5 n n =|   x−7 5   | MathType@MTEF@5@5@@58D4@
Note: lim n→∞ n n =1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@442A@ can be stated without additional work shown.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes three of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes four of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all five of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

A series written about x=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGimaaaa@3BB7@ earns neither point.

Terms could be presented in a list, as a third degree polynomial, or as part of a Taylor series.

Any additional terms presented are not to be considered.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned for g ′  ( x )=2 e f ( x )  ⋅  f ′  ( x ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@516E@ g ′  ( 7 )=2 e f ( 7 )  ·  f ′  ( 7 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4FAB@ or g ′  ( 7 )=2 e 0  ⋅  1 5 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@49A6@

A response of just 2 e 0  ⋅  1 5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@430B@ earns both points, but a response of just 2 ⋅  1 5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40C4@ or 2 5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AD3@ earns neither point.

The second point can be earned by consistent use of an incorrect, nonzero value for f ′  ( 7 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DCC@ imported from part (b).
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.
